DOCNAME: CASE OF DEL LATTE v. THE NETHERLANDS
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 6-2;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants , Mr PERSON and Mr PERSON , were born in DATE and DATE respectively and live in GPE , the GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicants went together to the home of CARDINAL Y. , with whom they had quarrelled in a bar earlier . Finding Y. at home , CARDINAL of them – apparently PERSON – fired CARDINAL shots from a gun in his general direction .

CARDINAL . The applicants were arrested on DATE and charged with the attempted murder , or in the alternative , the attempted manslaughter of PERSON applicant PERSON was in addition charged , in the further alternative , with aiding and abetting the attempted murder or manslaughter by PERSON .
CARDINAL . The applicants were taken into police custody ( inverzekeringstelling ) and thereafter kept in detention on remand ( voorlopige hechtenis ) .

CARDINAL . A first trial hearing took place before ORG ( arrondissementsrechtbank ) on DATE . On DATE ORG gave an interlocutory judgment remitting the case to the investigating judge ( rechter - commissaris ) for additional investigations .
A second trial hearing was held on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave judgment acquitting the applicants of all charges . This entailed the applicants ' immediate release from detention on remand .
The prosecution appealed .
CARDINAL . Following a hearing on DATE , ORG ( gerechtshof ) gave judgment on DATE upholding ORG acquittal .
Since in the GPE no appeal on points of law is possible against an acquittal ( LAW ) – hereinafter “ ORG ” ) , this brought the criminal proceedings to an end .
CARDINAL . Both applicants applied to ORG in DATE , each seeking monetary compensation in an amount of MONEY ( NLG ) for the time spent in pre - trial detention ( LAW CCP – see below ) .
CARDINAL . A hearing was held on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG gave decisions dismissing the applicants ' claims . Its reasoning , identical in both decisions , was the following ( emphasis added ) :

“ ORG finds that the file contains sufficient evidence to prove that the applicant together with his brother went to the home of the victim [ Y. ] in ORG and that shots were fired by CARDINAL of them through [ Y. ] 's living - room window with a firearm . At that moment [ Y. ] was in that living - room . However , it has not been established conclusively ( onomstotelijk ) that the shooting was intended to kill [ Y. ] .

However , in view of the other circumstances as they appear from the file , the actions of the applicant and his brother amounted to threats , within the meaning of LAW ( Wetboek van Strafrecht – hereinafter “ CC ” ) .
The behaviour of the applicant together with his brother in any case justified that he be taken into police custody and subsequently held in detention on remand .

ORG , and also ORG , have had to consider the case on the basis of the indictment prepared by the public prosecutor ( officier van justitie ) . This indictment was limited to attempted murder / manslaughter . It did not contain any charge of threatening to commit a crime directed against life .
ORG and ORG found insufficient evidence to support the charges contained in the indictment , and the applicant had to be acquitted as a consequence .
In the light of the above , ORG acquittal can be qualified as a ' technical ' acquittal , since adding a further alternative charge , as indicated above , would have led to a conviction .
In the circumstances ORG finds no reasons in equity to award the applicant any compensation for the police custody and detention on remand . ”
“ CARDINAL . Threatening [ to commit ] ... any crime directed against life ... shall be punishable by a term of imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fourth - category fine . ... ”
“ He who Deliberately deprives another of his life shall be guilty of manslaughter and shall be punished by a term of imprisonment not exceeding DATE or a fifth - category fine . ”

“ He who Deliberately and with malice aforethought ( met voorbedachten rade ) deprives another of his life shall be guilty of murder and shall be punished by imprisonment for life or for a term not exceeding twenty years or a fifth - category fine . ”

“ CARDINAL . If a case ends without the imposition of a punishment or measure , or when such punishment or measure is imposed but on the basis of a fact for which detention on remand is not allowed , the court may , at the request of the former accused , grant him compensation at the expense of the ORG for the damage which he has suffered as a result of police custody , clinical observation or detention on remand . Such damage may include non - pecuniary damage . ... ”
Article CARDINAL

“ CARDINAL . Compensation shall be awarded in each case if and to the extent that the court , taking all circumstances into account , is of the opinion that there are reasons in equity to do so . ... ”

“ CARDINAL . The indictment shall comprise a description of the fact with which the accused is charged , stating the approximate time and location where it has allegedly been perpetrated ; it shall also mention the statutory provisions under which the fact has been penalised .
CARDINAL . The indictment shall further set out the circumstances under which the fact has allegedly been perpetrated . ... ”

“ ... ORG shall Deliberate on the basis of the indictment ( op den grondslag der telastelegging ) and in the light of its investigation at the hearing as to whether it has been proven that the fact has been perpetrated by the accused , and , if so , what punishable act this gives rise to according to the law ; if the fact is found to be proven and punishable , then ORG shall Deliberate as to whether the accused can be punished and as to the imposition of a punishment or [ non - punitive ] measure as provided for by law . ”
“ CARDINAL . If ORG finds it not proven that the accused has perpetrated the fact charged in the indictment ( het hem telastegelegde TIME begaan ) , it shall acquit him . ... ”

CARDINAL . Articles CARDINAL , CARDINAL and CARDINAL considered together are consistently construed in domestic case - law as meaning that the trial courts must base their findings exclusively on the allegations presented in the indictment . Consequently , they can not convict someone of any given criminal offence if they do not find that each and all of the elements constitutive of that offence , as defined by statute , have been covered in the indictment , even if the case file contains conclusive evidence that the accused is in fact guilty of the offence ( see , among other authorities , the judgments of the Hoge Raad ( Supreme Court ) of DATE , PERSON Law Reports DATE , nos . CARDINAL and CARDINAL ) .
CARDINAL . Criminal appeal proceedings in the GPE being by way of a complete rehearing , the above provisions also apply on appeal ( LAW ) .
